results.title: The Greatest Art Movement: Transporting Art: the Story of Melbourne's Art Trams
results.creator_credit: Michael Buckley, National Heart Foundation of Australia. Victorian Division and Arts Victoria
results.brief_description: Trams have always been a feature of Melbourne life and they have now been transformed into moving art galleries. Melbourne’s Transporting Art Project involves a new series of decorated trams. Several of the artists discuss their reasons for taking part in the scheme, the themes behind their work and the unusual medium. Artists include Aleks Danko, Philip Faulks, Lin Onus, Terry Matassoni, Jenny Watson and Brett Colquhoun.
results.title_for_label: The Greatest Art Movement: Transporting Art: the Story of Melbourne’s Art Trams
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Buckley, National Heart Foundation of Australia. Victorian Division and Arts Victoria

results.title: Discovering the Murray-Darling Basin
results.creator_credit: Kenyon Castle, Murray-Darling Basin Commission (Australia) and Kenyon Castle Productions
results.brief_description: Mike Hayes presents this video which shows the immense variety of Australia’s most important agricultural region, stretching from Queensland to South Australia. Not only is the area important agriculturally, but it is also an area of great beauty, rich in wildlife, history and folk lore. Produced for the Murray-Darling Basin Commission the program stresses that almost everybody in Australia is dependent in some way on this vast area and that therefore we should be working to prevent further degradation and repair some of the damage which has already been done.

results.title: All that is solid
results.brief_description: This is a speculative documentary on the subject of the future of Australia. It is conceived as a series of competing discourses with visionaries, politicians, media commentators and others, who are variously optimistic and pessimistic. Interviews are interspersed with symbolic, imaginative drama.

results.title: Film work
results.creator_credit: John Hughes and Waterside Workers' Federation of Australia. Film Unit.
results.brief_description: This film recalls the work of the Waterside Workers’ Federation Film Unit. Financed by several trade unions, the Unit produced eleven (mainly documentary) films between 1953-58. There are excerpts from four of the films ‘Pensions for Veterans’, ‘The Hungry Miles’, ‘November Victory’ and ‘Hewers of Coal’ and interviews with the Unit members, Keith Gow, Norma Disher and Jock Levy. (Awards: ATOM 1982)

results.title: Ceremonial ground painting: Aboriginal women artists from Papunya (A)
results.creator_credit: Ian Stocks, Robyn Bondfield, Queensland Art Gallery and Kopano P/L Productions
results.brief_description: Eight women artists from the Papunya community were invited to Queensland Art Gallery to create a groundpainting that would enhance and extend the exhibition “The Inspired dream: life as art in Aboriginal Australia” This video documents the making of the painting, explanations of its symbolic meaning and the dancing ceremonies which are traditionally performed when the work is finished. The artists were Emma and Mali Nungurrayi, Topsy, Mary and Jeannie Napaltjarri, Mavis Napangati, Phylis Nakamarra and Mavis Nampitjinpa.

results.title: Aboriginal Education in Victoria: VAECG (A)
results.creator_credit: Vincent O'Donnell, Open Channel Productions and Melbourne State College. Media Production Centre
results.brief_description: Explains the workings of the Victorian Aboriginal Education Consultative Group. Shows how the group operates with Aboriginal and non-Aboriginal people in Shepparton, Robinvale and Echuca. Introduced by Norman Lacy, Assistant Minister of Education.

results.title: Broken white line (A)
results.brief_description: A documentation of the role of an Aboriginal social worker, depicting the enormity of the problems he is called upon to help solve in the Aboriginal community. DUE TO THE NATURE OF THE MATERIAL, TEACHER PREVIEW OF THE FILM BEFORE CLASSROOM SCREENING IS ESSENTIAL.

results.title: Even chance (A)
results.creator_credit: Martin Zierman, Sabina Baltrukomis, Victoria. Office of the Commissioner for Equal Opportunity and Curriculum Branch, Ministry of Ed
results.brief_description: Alice, a young Aboriginal woman, leaves her home in a country town to work in the city. She finds employment but things start to go wrong and eventually she is dismissed. Alice decides to take her case to the Office of the Commissioner for Equal Opportunity. The program highlights examples of harassment, prejudice, stereotyping and discrimination.

results.title: Get wet
results.creator_credit: Royal Life Saving Society and Image East
results.brief_description: The message of this humorous program featuring Jonathon Coleman is that water can be great fun providing you know how to enjoy it safely. Presents a number of typical scenarios - swimming pool, river and beach.

results.title: Australia's Best: Music & Images of Australians in the 80's
results.creator_credit: Pom Oliver, South Pacific Films and New South Wales Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A music video documentary showcasing the best of Australia’s popular music in the eighties. Features the music of Split Enz, Australian Crawl, INXS, No Fixed Address, Cold Chisel and Icehouse. Includes interviews with celebrities such as Michael Hutchence, Neil and Tim Finn, James Reyne and Grace Knight.
